materials.raw_text: B: 30 g, Er: 15 g, Fe: 80 g, Y: 20 g

sourcing.instructions: B (Boron powder) - Chemical supply stores; Er (Erbium oxide) - Rare earth material suppliers; Fe (Iron powder) - Metal supply stores; Y (Yttrium oxide) - Chemical suppliers specializing in rare earth elements.
steps: B (Boron powder) - Chemical supply stores; Er (Erbium oxide) - Rare earth material suppliers; Fe (Iron powder) - Metal supply stores; Y (Yttrium oxide) - Chemical suppliers specializing in rare earth elements.
1. Measure 30 g of boron powder and place in a clean, dry mixing container.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Measure 30 g of boron powder and place in a clean, dry mixing container.

steps: 1. After heating, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down naturally to room temperature (approx. 2-3 hours).
cooling.raw_text: 1. After heating, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down naturally to room temperature (approx. 2-3 hours).

steps: 1. After cooling, carefully remove the crucible and extract the solid sample.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. After cooling, carefully remove the crucible and extract the solid sample.
